info.title: Panviva
info.description:
Wouldn't it be great if you could share information seamlessly? This connector allows you to push your knowledge further and consume a complete list of Panviva's API offerings.

**Content APIs** perform resource related operations , e.g. `document`, `folder`, `file`, `container`, `image`.

**Live APIs** enable real-time communications with online users on our client application.

**Artefact APIs** interact with curated Panviva content, created by Digital Orchestrator.

get.description: Searches documents, folders, and files (external documents) for a term and returns paginated results

parameters.name: instance
parameters.description: The instance name as shown on the Panviva Developer Portal.

parameters.name: term
parameters.description: The word or phrase to be searched for

parameters.name: pageOffset
parameters.description: The pagination offset to denote the number of initial search results to skip. For example, pageOffset of 100 and pageLimit of 10 would return records 101-110.

parameters.name: pageLimit
parameters.description: The number of records to return. Must be an integer between 0 and 1000.

200.description: The operation is successful and returns with the requested resource. An example of a successful response can be seen in the Sample payload.

results.name: Spiderman Book
results.description: A book detailing the history of Spiderman
results.snippet: Spiderman is a hero born in New York

400.description: Bad Request - The request could not be understood by the server due to malformed syntax. The client should not repeat the request without modifications.

404.description: Document not found - The server has not found anything matching the request URI.

405.description: Method Not Allowed - The method specified in the request is not allowed for the resource identified by the request URI.

406.description: Not Acceptable - The resource identified by the request is only capable of generating response entities which have content characteristics not acceptable according to the accept headers sent in the request. If accept headers is specified, application/json must be the only media type.

415.description: Unsupported Media Type - The server is refusing to service the request because the entity of the request is in a format not supported by the requested resource for the requested method. The only supported media type is application/json.

429.description: Too many requests - The number of requests has reached the plan’s rate limit.

503.description: Service Unavailable - Panviva servers are under maintenance.

get.description: Return search results for a given query

parameters.name: instance
parameters.description: The instance name as shown on the Panviva Developer Portal.

parameters.name: simplequery
parameters.description: Natural language query string. For example: ```Action Movies```. (Note: Use simplequery OR advancedquery, not both.)

parameters.name: advancedquery
parameters.description: Query string written in Lucene query syntax. For example: ```films AND "a story"```. (Note: Use simplequery OR advancedquery, not both.)

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Accepts a Lucene-formatted filter string. Examples: ```category eq 'Mortgages'```, ```panvivaDocumentVersion gt '8'```. (Filterable fields include dateCreated, dateModified, dateDeleted, categoryJson, queryVariationsJson, title, category, primaryQuery, isDeleted, timestamp, panvivaDocumentId, panvivaDocumentVersion, id)

parameters.name: channel
parameters.description: Return response for a specific channel, instead of the default

parameters.name: pageOffset
parameters.description: The pagination offset to denote the number of initial search results to skip. For example, pageOffset of 100 and pageLimit of 10 would return records 101-110.

parameters.name: pageLimit
parameters.description: The number of records to return. Must be an integer between 0 and 1000.

parameters.name: facet
parameters.description: Accepts a Lucene-formatted facet string. Examples: ```facet=Category,count:10&facet=Rating```. (Facetable fields include metaData/values)

200.description: The operation is successful and returns with the requested resource. An example of a successful response can be seen in the Sample payload.

content.text: The Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU) is an American media franchise and shared universe that is centered on a series of superhero films.

results.primaryQuery: What is the Marvel Cinematic Universe?
results.title: About Marvel Cinematic Universe

get.description: Return a document using the document ID provided

parameters.name: instance
parameters.description: The instance name as shown on the Panviva Developer Portal.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A document unique identifier, Document ID. If a document is a translated document, this value represents Internal ID or IID in Panviva API v1.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: Request the API to return a particular version of the specified document.

200.description: The operation is successful and returns with the requested resource. An example of a successful response can be seen in the Sample payload.

application/json.name: Marvel Cinematic Universe (Films)
application/json.description: The Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU) is an American media franchise and shared universe that is centered on a series of superhero films.

training.failureFeedback: Please review the Marvel documentation in document 343
training.successFeedback: With great power comes great responsibility.

parameters.description: The internal id (IID) of a Panviva folder

username.description: The Panviva user to whom you wish to send the result. (Note: Use username OR userId, not both.)

userId.description: The numeric ID of the user to whom you wish to send the result. (Note: Use username OR userId, not both.)

query.description: The CSH term to search for.

showFirstResult.description: True to immediately open the first document found, or false to show the list of results.

maximizeClient.description: True/False depending on whether you want the Panviva client to maximize on the user's desktop, when the document is delivered.

username.description: The Panviva user to whom you wish to send the result. (Note: Use username OR userId, not both.)

userId.description: The numeric ID of the user to whom you wish to send the result. (Note: Use username OR userId, not both.)

id.description: The Document ID of the Panviva Document you wish to send.

location.description: The Section ID you would like the user to see, when the specified document is opened.

maximizeClient.description: True/False depending on whether you want the Panviva client to maximize on the user's desktop, when the document is delivered.

username.description: The Panviva user to whom you wish to send the result. (Note: Use username OR userId, not both.)

userId.description: The numeric ID of the user to whom you wish to send the result. (Note: Use username OR userId, not both.)

maximizeClient.description: True/False depending on whether you want the Panviva client to maximize on the user's desktop, when the document is delivered.

showFirstResult.description: True to immediately open the first document found, or false to show the list of results.
